name: Education for Homeless Children and Youth
objective: To ensure that all homeless children and youth have equal access to the same free, appropriate public education available to other children, the Education for Homeless Children and Youth program provides assistance to States to: (1) establish or designate an Office of Coordinator for Education of Homeless Children and Youths; (2) develop and carry out a State plan for the education of homeless children; and (3) make subgrants to local educational agencies (LEAs) to support the education of those children.
sub_agency_name: Office of Elementary and Secondary Education
applicant_types: State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: Made grants to 56 State educational agencies.
Made grants to 56 State educational agencies.
Made grants to 56 State educational agencies.

authorizations.text: McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act, Title VII, Subtitle B.

rules_regulations: Guidance for the Education for Homeless Children and Youth program may be obtained from the Headquarters Office contact below.
